critique: This executive order focuses on preventing nuclear proliferation by ensuring the proper handling and use of fissile material removed from Russian nuclear weapons. It aims to uphold agreements with Russia regarding the conversion of highly enriched uranium into low-enriched uranium for peaceful uses. The order blocks assets of the Russian Federation directly related to these agreements to prevent their attachment or seizure, which could jeopardize the agreements' implementation. It delegates authority to the Secretary of the Treasury to implement the order and requires reports to Congress. There is nothing about immigration, so that should be neutral. There is nothing explicitly about social inclusion or economic regulation. The order invokes national security concerns and acts to protect agreements with another country, which could be seen as expanding executive power to some extent. It also centralizes authority at the federal level to implement and enforce the order.
